column1: Examples of these methods are described below: - Low-dose overnight -- you will get 1 mg of dexamethasone at 11 p.m., and a health care provider will draw your blood at 8 a.m. for a cortisol measurement.

The health care provider may tell you to stop taking certain medicines that can affect the test, including: - Antibiotics - Anti-seizure drugs such as corticosteroids (hydrocortisone, prednisone) - Estrogen - Oral birth control (contraceptives) - Water pills (diuretics)
